channel.title: jagEd jagex - editor v5.32 ~~ runescape 3d software. specifically what is it?
channel.description:
(if this is in the wrong section, move it to the right one)
Title says it all...
I've always wanted to know what 3D software Jagex uses and i think it's custom program that they made?? idk? but i want to know the specific software. I got a pic if anyone can guess what it is.
Here is a picture of what i've seen in their youtube developer's blog vid.
[IMG]http://i52.tinypic.com/2dwbq8.jpg[/img]

item.title: jagEd jagex - editor v5.32 ~~ runescape 3d software. specifically what is it?
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:6, topic:358945”]Jagex is filled with a bunch of nerds put to labor into a room for 7 hours a day
On topic, I think they’re smart to make their own program and use it instead of using… Metasequoia. That way it will be harder to make things… Right? :o[/quote]

Which they earn a monthly salary for. You do it out of free will

Read full topic

item.title: jagEd jagex - editor v5.32 ~~ runescape 3d software. specifically what is it?
item.dc:creator: @tehjamdude tehjamdude
item.description:
@tehjamdude wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:6, topic:358945”]Jagex is filled with a bunch of nerds put to labor into a room for 7 hours a day
On topic, I think they’re smart to make their own program and use it instead of using… Metasequoia. That way it will be harder to make things… Right? :o[/quote]

I heard that there is an actual company that made it for Jagex. I also heard that people had it and were selling it, but I checked and it wasn’t there ??

Metaseq isn’t that bad for making models, if you understand what the hell your doing… I use blender to animate, it doesn’t take to long…

Read full topic

item.title: jagEd jagex - editor v5.32 ~~ runescape 3d software. specifically what is it?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

rip4d:

I thought they mentioned Maya and Lightwave in that youtube video ._.

I’m pretty sure Andrew or MMG said they based their software on Maya. They probably just rebuilt a Java-version of Maya from the ground up, with a lot less functionality. Then they add their special stuff to make it collaborate with their distribution process, their proprietary format, the face packing, etc etc. Jagex cares that much lol. ;D

Read full topic
